result.title: Z-Factor system for Deployment & Demonstration
result.description:
In detail definition of the overall methodological framework for the validation of the Z-Factor solution with respect to the evaluation of the level of fulfilment of the project objectives, and the value of its results in terms of their apprecia-tion by factory stakeholders and decision makers, and in terms of their impact on the factory operation
1st version of the deliverable will be submitted on M32 to accomodate the WP6 (demo). The final version on M36 - end of T5.2.

result.title: Report on MSL demo activities (M42)
result.description: The Z-Fact0r strategies will be implemented in the premises of MSL. This task will be linked with the results of the use case design in T1.4. The assembly is a multistage process starting with 1) Visual inspection of the base PCB 2) Glue dot dispense 3) Placement of the die/component 4) Glue cure 5) Wirebond die The glue dot placement process is shown in the figure below and is the most critical problem area. The placement machine (Tresky T-8000) has no optical inspection and no method to automatically correct for the amount of glue being dispensed into the cavity. Consequently visual inspection of the assemblies has to take place and manual adjustment of the amount of glue deposited.

result.title: Report on training activities
result.description: Concept for internal and external trainings will be developed in order to provide short courses, seminars or e-learning modules which will provide understanding of the Z-Fact0r approach and concepts and support the take-up of the Z-Fact0r results by potential customers This will be achieved by the identification and analysis of training needs, the identification of the appropriate train-ing set-up and the elaboration of the training documents and training guidelines on the basis of the project continuous integration. All the training materials will follow a learning by doing methodology, such as the teaching factory. A final version will be adapted according to the feedback of the training participants. The final training documents will compose a competence management system that may then be used for take-up activities and further exploitation of the project results.

result.title: ELG platform (final release)
result.description: Software code and report. The full ELG platform will be delivered, integrating all remaining services required for the management and maintenance of the platform, i.e., user billing and payment services, monitoring of the platform, monitoring of remotely offered services, platform usage analytics, which are the object of T2.8. The final catalogue will be enriched in T2.7 with resources from the pilots (WP6, and external sources identified by the Grid community (WP7).

result.title: Run-time access based control -- report and prototype
result.description: Models from T4.2 will be used to detect anomalous components, which will be automatically isolated by a prototype tool. A set of fingerprint models will be created and analyzed. The usability of these fingerprints and models for automatic security controls will be tested and evaluated.The demonstration parts of software prototypes will be made available to boost replication whereas for the other parts (including source code) the consortium will identify a suitable intellectual property management strategy and misuses prevention strategy so that they will be made available as confidential annexes or disseminated to the Open Source Community.

result.title: Services, Tools and Components (final release)
result.description: D4.3 will consist of software code and a report. D4.3 will include the final inventory of existing and prioritised tools and services (result of T4.1). D4.3 will also include the complete set of tools and services integrated within the ELG (result of Tasks 4.2-4.5). The task leaders will be responsible for integration of tools and services for each LT category (i.e., task), with all relevant prioritised ones from T4.1 now integrated in ELG. The key new aspect in D4.3 will be the complete set of integrated 3rd party tools and services, now available through the ELG (T4.6). All integrated tools and services will thus contribute towards the final ELG release (M34).

result.description: A report will be delivered that describes the techniques used to link code to states and identify mismatches between design and run-time models. result.title: Data sets, identified gaps, produced resources and models (version 2)
result.description: D5.2 will continue the documentation of identified and collected resources ingested into the ELG platform (see D5.1). D5.2 will also report on the use of LRs by the SMEs and pilot projects (including a statistical analysis). The report will document the gap analysis with regard to LRs, the involvement of the European LT Board and the rationale behind the choices made for the production of new LRs. It will also report on the corresponding LR production process (specification, management, documentation, inclusion in DMP etc.). D5.2 will also report on the results of T5.3 (e.g., choice of models to be produced in the platform).

result.title: Data sets, models, identified gaps, produced resources and their exploitation within the ELG (version 3)
result.description: D5.3 will summarise all operations of the ELG with regard to LRs and data sets. It will document the final list of collected resources and their use by the ELG community. It will update the gap analysis and the set of models produced. It will report on the production of LRs through the pilot projects (if any) and on all legal and ethical issues faced by the ELG (including GDPR compliance).

result.title: ELG platform (interim release)
result.description: Software code and report. The updated version of the platform will include the components and APIs required for running language processing services (containerised services stored in the ELG and web services via REST APIs) directly in ELG, which will be developed in T2.5 and T2.6. It will include an updated catalogue with resources from ELG partners (results of T4.2-4.5, T5.1) populating the platform in T2.3. D2.5 will update the previous documentation.
